edu.caltech.sbw
Class RPCOutCall

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--edu.caltech.sbw.RPCOutCall
public class RPCOutCall
extends Object

Message formats

There are four message types:
  • reply message (code 0)
  • send message (code 1)
  • call message (code 2)
  • error message (code 3)
Call and send messages have the following form: 
 ,--------v------v------v-----v-----v------------v-----------v------.
 | length | dest | type | mID | src | service id | method id | data |
 `--------^------^------^-----^-----^------------^-----------^------'
where the meanings of the fields are as follows:
length
(4 bytes) the length of the message, including the length field
dest
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the destination module for the message
type
(1 byte) the message type code (call, send, reply, error)
mID
(4 bytes) a unique identifier/sequence number for this message
src
(4 bytes) the identifier of the source module originating this message
service id
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the desired service
method id
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the desired method on the service
data
(arbitrary) the arguments to the method

Reply messages have the following format: 

 ,--------v------v------v-----v------.
 | length | dest | type | mID | data |
 `--------^------^------^-----^------'
where the meanings of the fields are as follows:
length
(4 bytes) the length of the message, including the length field
dest
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the destination module for the message
type
(1 byte) the message type code (call, send, reply, error)
mID
(4 bytes) a unique identifier/sequence number for this message
data
(arbitrary) the arguments to the method

Error messages have the following format: 

 ,--------v------v------v-----v-------v----------v--------------.
 | length | dest | type | mID | error | user msg | detailed msg |
 `--------^------^------^-----^-------^----------^--------------'
where the meanings of the fields are as follows:
length
(4 bytes) the length of the message, including the length field
dest
(4 bytes) an identifier indicating the destination module for the message
type
(1 byte) the message type code (call, send, reply, error)
mID
(4 bytes) a unique identifier/sequence number for this message
error
(1 byte) a code indicating the type of exception
user msg
(arbitrary) a string giving a user-readable message of the error
detailed msg
(arbitrary) a string giving a more detailed error message

Version:

Author:
Andrew Finney, $Author: mhucka $

Constructor Detail

RPCOutCall

public RPCOutCall()
Method Detail

waitForReply

public DataBlockReader waitForReply(int moduleId)
                             throws SBWException
Wait for a reply on a call to a module. This method assumes that after the wait, the internal DataBlockReader contains either the return data or the type and message strings of an exception. If the reply comes through and is normal reply, this returns the DataBlockReader containing the data; otherwise, if the reply indicates an exceptional condition, this throws a subclass of SBWException.
Parameters:
moduleId - the numeric identifier of the destination module.

processReply

public void processReply(DataBlockReader reader,
                         boolean isException)
assume that reader contains either the return data from a call or type and message strings of an exception

onBrokerDisconnection

public void onBrokerDisconnection()
Method called to indicate that we have lost our connection to the broker. It's used by SBWRPC.cleanupPendingCalls() in the process of cleaning up outgoing calls upon a shutdown or other serious event.

onOtherModuleInstanceShutdown

public void onOtherModuleInstanceShutdown(int otherModuleId)
Method called when another module says it is shutting down.
